alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:21PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Big Horn, western Powder River, southern Rosebud and southeastern Treasure Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 619 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms extending from northern Big Horn County to eastern Powder River County, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hardin, Colstrip, Lodge Grass, Lame Deer, Busby, Crow Agency, Ashland, Birney, Wyola, Tongue River Reservoir, Birney Village, Otter, Brandenberg, Kirby, Muddy Cluster, Rosebud Battlefield Park, Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation and Crow Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for south central Montana.

area.areaDesc: Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud; Treasure
